description:
'''Christian rock''' is a form of [[rock music]] that features [[lyrics]] focusing on matters of [[Christian faith]], often with an emphasis on [[Jesus in Christianity|Jesus]]. This music is typically performed by [[Christians|Christian]] individuals. The extent to which their lyrics are explicitly Christian varies between [[Band (rock and pop)|bands]]. Many bands who perform Christian rock have ties to the [[contemporary Christian music]] labels, media outlets, and [[Music festival|festivals]], while other bands are independent.

In the 2000s and onwards, Christian rock bands [[Skillet (band)|Skillet]], [[Thousand Foot Krutch]], and [[Red (band)|Red]] were influenced by acts like [[Linkin Park]] to develop their own sounds that combined [[hard rock]] and [[nu metal]]. Skillet received [[Grammy Award|Grammy]] nominations for two albums, along with having two albums certified platinum and double platinum. Red also received Grammy nominations for two albums.
